. "I genuinely on an hourly basis want to teach myself that this is what can happen when you're successful is that you start to believe your own hype," he explained. Then you start living in this bubble, which is your world, and you start to believe that that's the only world that exists. Which is why most successful people screw it up for themselves normally within two, three, five, ten years. Because they stop listening. The biggest failures I've had were at a time when I believed my own hype. Mr David Cameron said he was "very sorry" Mr Andy Coulson felt "compelled" to go after months of intense pressure, insisting he was being punished for the same offence twice . Mr Andy Coulson resigned as editor of the News of the World in 2007 after the paper's former royal editor, Clive Goodman , and private investigator Glenn Mulcaire were jailed for phone hacking.
